premise: A four wheel drive car is splashing through puddles on an off road trail.
hypothesis: The car is 2 wheel drive.
explanation_1: A car cannot be both a four wheel drive and a 2 wheel drive.

premise: A group of women having a discussion.
hypothesis: A woman is drinking coffee alone.
explanation_1: having and drinking are different things

premise: A child on a red slide.
hypothesis: A biker goes through a busy intersection.
explanation_1: A child on a red slide does not mean a biker going through a busy intersection.

premise: A woman is doing yoga and smiling at the camera.
hypothesis: A jogger is smiling at the camera.
explanation_1: A jogger doesn't do yoga.

premise: A dog is about to catch a treat in his mouth.
hypothesis: The dog rolls over to earn a treat.
explanation_1: The dog rolling over to earn a treat contradicts with dog about to catch a treat in first sentence.

premise: man and women in a halloween costume having a conversation
hypothesis: Two people are going swimming.
explanation_1: People do not typically go swimming while wearing a Halloween costume.

premise: Three chefs in white uniforms preparing food.
hypothesis: Everyone is eating food.
explanation_1: PREPARING IS NOT EATING

premise: A woman wearing a black jacket, red and white sneakers, and a red bandanna sits on a bench.
hypothesis: A woman is wearing all white.
explanation_1: Person wearing black jacket can not be wearing all white at the same time.

premise: A man holds his child at a restaurant as the child reaches across the table.
hypothesis: The man is sleeping.
explanation_1: He could not be holding a child if he is sleeping.

premise: A young girl, blond and wearing a polka-dot shirt, washes a stuffed animal in a vanity sink.
hypothesis: A girl a ripping her stuffed bear.
explanation_1: If the girl washes the stuffed animal, then she must not be ripping it.

premise: The Little girl poses for a Photo in front of Flowers and Pumpkins.
hypothesis: the girl is asleep
explanation_1: The little girl cannot simultaneously pose for a photo and be asleep

premise: One football player running towards another player.
hypothesis: The ballerina is playing football.
explanation_1: The person can either be a ballerina or football player

premise: A man in a plaid shirt is hiding his face as his arms are being held behind him by a man in a black shirt.
hypothesis: A girl plays on a beach.
explanation_1: A man is not a girl.

premise: A closeup of an elderly man wearing glasses.
hypothesis: a picture of a woman standing on a hillside
explanation_1: The picture is either of an elderly man or a woman.

premise: A young male child with curly brown hair, hiding behind a cardboard box in a vegetable vendor's market.
hypothesis: The boy was in plain sight
explanation_1: hiding and being in plain sight are impossible together.

premise: An Asian Indian man in a yellow madras shirt asleep next to a woman in a red print dress.
hypothesis: A naked couple sleep next to each other peacefully.
explanation_1: A man is not a couple.

premise: Three women sitting and talking in a tiled area under a sign Jane.
hypothesis: a group of ladies playing chess in france
explanation_1: The women are either talking or playing chess.

premise: Amateur chef wearing a white cooking apron is about to chop a chicken with a butcher knife.
hypothesis: A chef screams at a person in a bathroom.
explanation_1: One cannot be about to chop a chicken and be screaming in a bathroom simultaneously.

premise: Kids playing softball.
hypothesis: The kids are playing video games.
explanation_1: Video games are different than softball and you cannot be playing both at the same time.

premise: A group of mountain climbers treks in snowy terrain.
hypothesis: A group of climbers sleep in hot desert.
explanation_1: The group cannot either sleep or trek, but not both. A hot desert is opposite from snowy terrain.

premise: Three women outside working with one pushing a red wheelbarrow.
hypothesis: The red wheelbarrow is tipped up against a wall.
explanation_1: The red wheelbarrow cannot be pushed and also tipped up against a wall at the same time.

premise: A waterskier high in the air above the green water.
hypothesis: waterskiing on the green water
explanation_1: The waterskier is either above or on the green water.

premise: A woman wearing all black except for brown boots is standing next to a tagged wall.
hypothesis: Girl tagging wall.
explanation_1: A girl is not a woman.

premise: A lady with short hair wearing a black jacket leaned against a lamp post outside a building.
hypothesis: The lady is running
explanation_1: The lady cannot be running and be leaned against something at the same time.

premise: Two large dogs attempt to bite each other playfully.
hypothesis: two cats wrestle
explanation_1: Two cats cannot be two large dogs. It must either be two cats, or vice versa.

premise: A group of men are playing rugby.
hypothesis: The men  was  inside  watching  tv
explanation_1: If people are playing rugby they are not also watching tv.

premise: A woman with a white purse walks across a gray platform in front of a tall building.
hypothesis: A man is sitting in an igloo.
explanation_1: A woman is not a man.

premise: A man with a red helmet kayaking.
hypothesis: A man wearing no helmet that is kayaking.
explanation_1: Person with helmet can not be with no helmet at the same time.

premise: An asian woman holding a plucked chicken.
hypothesis: The chicken sovles a math problem.
explanation_1: Chickens do not solve math problems.  A woman is not a chicken.

premise: A little boy shoveling snow.
hypothesis: The boy is shoveling gravel.
explanation_1: snow and gravel are different things

premise: A baseball hitter holding a bat falling down.
hypothesis: A baseball player is blocking the soccer ball with his bat.
explanation_1: The baseball player is either holding a bat falling down or blocking the soccer ball with his bat.

premise: Girl is upside down over a gymnastics floor.
hypothesis: The girl sits on the gym floor.
explanation_1: If a girl is upside down she does not sit on the floor.

premise: A man doing clean up work of brush around a public area.
hypothesis: A bear eating berries.
explanation_1: An object cannot be referred to as a man and a bear simultaneously.

premise: Two men standing near a dog.
hypothesis: The dog is cooking bacon.
explanation_1: Men aren't dogs.

premise: A female wrestler is being diagnosed by a doctor in a sports arena with spectators in the background.
hypothesis: Two men are wrestling each other.
explanation_1: If the wrestler is female, she cannot be one of the two men.

premise: The woman is at marketplace buying fish from an Arabic person.
hypothesis: The woman is at the grocery store buying hamburgers.
explanation_1: The woman who is buying fish isn't buying hamburgers.

premise: Two young boys playing soccer leaping in midair as they vie for the ball.
hypothesis: Boys are in English class.
explanation_1: The boys are either playing soccer and leaping, or are in English class.

premise: A young lady poses for photo with her dog.
hypothesis: Woman taking picture with her cat
explanation_1: A woman does not imply that she is a young lady.  A cat and dog are separate animals.

premise: A city street where a man in a yellow shirt is looking down on the ground.
hypothesis: a man in a red shirt is running in a country field.
explanation_1: yellow  is not the same as  red

premise: Two adults, one female in white, with shades and one male, gray clothes, walking across a street, away from a eatery with a blurred image of a dark colored red shirted person in the foreground.
hypothesis: Some people board a train.
explanation_1: Eatery is a completely different activity than boarding a train.

premise: A man walking down the street carrying a shopping bag.
hypothesis: a man carrying a baby
explanation_1: It is either shopping bag or baby.

premise: A man in a black cap and blue coat is playing the accordion while sitting down.
hypothesis: the woman in black played the flute
explanation_1: It can either be a man or a woman. One cannot be playing the flute and playing the accordion simultaneously.

premise: A white guy in black biking gear is riding through the forest.
hypothesis: a man is sitting at home on the couch
explanation_1: The guy is either riding through the forest, or is sitting at home on the couch.

premise: A woman in a yellow bikini top and sunglasses in a crowd of people on a boardwalk.
hypothesis: The woman is skiing down a slope.
explanation_1: Bikini tops are not used for skiing.

premise: A windsurfer speeds towards the beach.
hypothesis: The windsurfer is sitting on the beach.
explanation_1: One may not be heading towards the beach and be on the beach at the same time

premise: A man is by a shopping cart with people walking on the street.
hypothesis: The man is alone indoors.
explanation_1: If the man is by people on the street, he is not alone indoors.
